page.title: 04MAYPOLE DANCING
page.content: One of the customs still carried on in the area is the Maypole dancing at the infants school.I was once a May Queen attendant.We wore white dresses which had red trimming around the bottom and a red sash around my waist.I can remember going up to the Junior school with my maypole in the rain.My maypole was the frame of an old umbrella with bright coloured tissue paper streamers and flowers on top of the frame to cover the strips of metal wire.It also had a red shiny handle.The pole had a clip which kept slipping and the frame kept falling.The May Queen wore a long white dress,a red velvet cloak and carried a bouquet of flowers.This custom is carried on at the beginning of May every year at Castle Park school and at Anslow school.
